components.description:
A triangle or set square, as used by engineers or architects to draw straight lines at angles. Variously depicted as a metal, wood, or plastic right triangle with length markings, its hypotenuse to the right.

Commonly applied to a range of disciplines, including art, design, building, architecture, and STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics). May also represent various concepts of angles and measurement.
components.title: Triangular Ruler

description:
A triangle or set square, as used by engineers or architects to draw straight lines at angles. Variously depicted as a metal, wood, or plastic right triangle with length markings, its hypotenuse to the right.

Commonly applied to a range of disciplines, including art, design, building, architecture, and STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics). May also represent various concepts of angles and measurement.
title: Triangular Ruler

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A¬†triangle-shaped ruler. Used for drawing diagonal lines, or for measurement. Triangular Ruler was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 a http://emojipedia.org/triangular-ruler/
emoji_net_data.name: triangular ruler

bn:00050816n: Many paper size standards conventions have existed at different times and in different countries.
The articles typically sold by stationers, comprising paper, pens, ink, quills, blank books, etc.
Stationery has historically pertained to a wide gamut of materials: paper and office supplies, writing implements, greeting cards, glue, pencil cases and other similar items.
Paper cut to an appropriate size for writing letters; usually with matching envelopes
The size of the sheet of paper on which you print the publication, before trimming.

A document that, when opened by the user, is duplicated by the system; the copy is opened for the user's modification while the original document remains intact. Stationery documents can be used as document templates or boilerplates.

bn:00069476n: A triangle is a polygon with three edges and three vertices.
One of the basic shapes in geometry
A geometric figure that consists of three straight limiting lines (sides) and three corners that are the intersection points of two sides
A triangle having each of its three sides of different lengths.
A polygon with three sides and three angles.
A triangle with no two sides of equal length

bn:00053823n: Mathematics is the study of topics such as quantity, structure, space, and change.
The application of principles associated with Cavalieri's principle.
The science that deals with concepts such as quantity, structure, space and change.
An abstract representational system used in the study of numbers, shapes, structure, change and the relationships between these concepts.
A science (or group of related sciences) dealing with the logic of quantity and shape and arrangement
Mathematics is the body of knowledge centered on concepts such as quantity, structure, space, and change, and the academic discipline which studies them.
Abstract study of numbers, quantity, structure, relationships, etc.
